1. A commit is a snapshot of changes in a repository. They are created to capture the state of a project at a point in time.

2. A branch in git is an independent line of development. It is version of a repository and allows collaborators to work on changes independently. 

3. A pull request in GitHub could be defined as a proposal or request to merge changes from one branch into another. 

4. git init

5. git clone <the url of the repository to be cloned>

6. git add . (to stage all changes)
   git add <file name>  (to stage a particular file)

7. git push origin <branch name>
